newsitem.title: USA: Techs jump on PC sales report, pushing Nasdaq up.
newsitem.headline: Techs jump on PC sales report, pushing Nasdaq up.

text.p: Nasdaq shares rose Monday as technology stocks welcomed reports that global shipments of personal computers jumped in the first quarter, traders said.

The Nasdaq composite index gained 7.74 points or 0.64 percent to close unofficially at 1217.03. The session was mixed, with declining issues beating gaining issues 2221 to 1860 on total volume of 462.8 million shares.

Reports from Dataquest and International Data Corp (IDC) indicated that global shipments of personal computers jumped 16 percent in the first quarter. A report from also said U.S. shipments rose 20 percent, the best quarterly growth rate since the end of 1995.
"The report calmed some anxeity about PC sales, making people feel more comfortable to do some buying today. But it was a pretty cautious day overall. Not a lot of activity," one trader said.
Intel Corp gained 2-1/2 to 146-3/8, Dell Computer Corp added 1-3/16 to 78-5/16 and Microsoft Corp increased 1-1/4 to 114-7/8.
Giddings & Lewis Inc soared 6-47/64 to 20-23/64 after Harnischfeger Industries Inc launched a tender offer, which values Giddings at $747 million including debt.
